bsym.permutations module¶

bsym.permutations.flatten_list(this_list)[source]¶
bsym.permutations.unique_permutations(seq)[source]¶

Yield only unique permutations of seq in an efficient way.

A python implementation of Knuth’s “Algorithm L”, also known from the std::next_permutation function of C++, and as the permutation algorithm of Narayana Pandita.

see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12836385/how-can-i-interleave-or-create-unique-permutations-of-two-stings-without-recurs/12837695

bsym.pymatgen_interface module¶

bsym.pymatgen_interface.poscar_from_sitelist(configs, labels, sitelists, structure, subset=None)[source]¶

Uses pymatgen Structure.to() method to generates POSCAR files for a set of configurations within a parent structure. :param configs: site configurations :type configs: list :param labels: atom labels to output :type labels: list :param sitelist: list of sites in fractional coords :type sitelist: list :param structure: Parent structure :type structure: pymatgen Structure :param subset: list of atom indices to output :type subset: Optional [list]

bsym.pymatgen_interface.spacegroup_from_structure(structure, subset=None)[source]¶

Generates a SpaceGroup object from a pymatgen Structure :param structure: structure to be used to define the SpaceGroup. :type structure: pymatgen Structure :param subset: list of atom indices to be used for generating the symmetry operations :type subset: Optional [list]

Returns:a new SpaceGroup instance
bsym.pymatgen_interface.unique_symmetry_operations_as_vectors_from_structure(structure, verbose=True, subset=None)[source]¶

Uses pymatgen symmetry analysis to find the minimum complete set of symmetry operations for the space group of a structure.

Parameters:
  • structure (pymatgen Structure) – structure to be analysed.
  • subset (Optional [list]) – list of atom indices to be used for generating the symmetry operations
Returns:

a list of lists, containing the symmetry operations as vector mappings.
